column2: CALIFORNIA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 2. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Do not enter.
column6: Stop.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 3. Which of these is the proper way to change lanes:
column4: Check your mirrors, look over your shoulder, then change lanes.
column6: Signal, check your mirrors, and then change lanes.
column8: Signal, check your mirrors, and look over your shoulder before you change lanes.

column2: 4. You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:
column4: signal before you arrive at the intersection.
column6: move to the left of the center lane.
column8: turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.

column2: 5. This red and white sign means:
column4: drivers may not enter the road from their direction.
column6: stop and proceed with caution.
column8: the road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions.

column2: 6. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to freeway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: enter the freeway and accelerate quickly.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.

column2: 7. When parking your vehicle parallel to the curb on a level street:
column4: One of your rear wheels must touch the curb.
column6: Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.
column8: Your front wheels must be turned toward the street.

column2: 8. Cargo extending more than four feet from your rear bumper:
column4: is illegal under all circumstances.
column6: does not legally have to be marked, but it is a good idea.
column8: must be marked with a red flag or lights.

column2: 9. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians may turn right.

column2: 10. Speed limit signs are:
column4: service signs
column6: warning signs
column8: regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 11. Pedestrians may be at risk walking near hybrid and electric vehicles because these vehicles:
column4: are not subject to standard speed limits.
column6: are generally faster than most other vehicles.
column8: are virtually silent while operating.

column2: 12. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 13. Never make a U-turn:
column4: in front of a fire station.
column6: on a railroad crossing.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 14. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the steering ability.
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column8: It improves the vehicle stability.

column2: 15. Highways are typically most slippery:
column4: after it has been raining for a long time.
column6: during a heavy rainstorm in the middle of the summer.
column8: when it first starts to rain after a dry spell.

column2: 16. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.

column2: 17. You must look for bicycle riders in the same lane used by motor vehicles because they:
column4: illegally share lanes with motor vehicles.
column6: must ride facing oncoming traffic.
column8: are entitled to share the road with you.

column2: 18. A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:
column4: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
column6: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.
column8: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

column2: 19. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
column4: causes traffic congestion.
column6: helps prevent rear-end collisions.
column8: improves traffic flow.

column2: 20. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 21. If five or more vehicles are following you on a narrow two-lane road:
column4: drive into the turnout areas or lanes to let them pass.
column6: move to the right side of your lane and drive slowly.
column8: continue driving because you have the right-of-way.

column2: 22. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: a stop sign.
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.
column8: a yield sign.

column2: 23. This road sign is:
column4: a regulatory sign.
column6: a speed reduction sign.
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 24. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective orange triangle
column6: A reflective white triangle
column8: A reflective yellow diamond

column2: 25. A green-painted curb means:
column4: Park for a limited time.
column6: Parking is permitted only for a disabled person.
column8: Stop no longer than the time posted to load or unload passengers or freight.

column2: 26. Weaving in and out of freeway lanes during heavy traffic:
column4: improves traffic flow by creating space for others to merge.
column6: increases fuel efficiency.
column8: causes further traffic congestion by slowing down other vehicles.

column2: 27. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road. Drive with caution.
column6: Warning: drunk drivers.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 28. It is a good habit to signal continuously during the last 100 feet before you turn at an intersection:
column4: unless your turn is protected by a green arrow.
column6: even if you do not see any other vehicles around.
column8: unless you are in a designated turn lane.

column2: 29. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.

column2: 30. If there are no sidewalks, pedestrians should:
column4: walk in the direction of traffic.
column6: walk facing oncoming traffic.
column8: stop walking.

column2: 31. You should use your horn when:
column4: it may help prevent a collision.
column6: another driver makes a mistake.
column8: another vehicle is in your way.

column2: 32. It is illegal for a person under age 21 to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is _______ or higher.
33. You are driving 55 MPH in the far left (fast) lane of a freeway posted for 65 MPH. You could be cited for driving too slowly:
column4: Under no circumstances because it is always safer to drive slower than other traffic.
column6: If you block the normal and reasonable flow of traffic.
column8: If the road or weather conditions warrant driving this slowly.

column2: 34. When you are in a dedicated turn lane controlled by a green arrow, which of the following is true?
column4: All oncoming vehicles and pedestrians are stopped by red lights.
column6: All vehicles or pedestrians in the intersection must yield to you.
column8: You may turn in the arrowâ€™s direction without checking traffic.

column2: 35. You are being crowded by a tailgater. What should do?
column4: Increase your speed to prevent being hit from behind by the tailgater!
column6: Brake suddenly and merge into another lane.
column8: Allow extra room ahead, do not brake suddenly.

column2: 36. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead.
column6: Divided highway ends.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
